Calculate PISQ-12 (Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire) Scores

Source: R/calculate_pisq12.R
calculate_pisq12.Rd

Calculates the Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire (PISQ-12) score, which measures sexual function in women with pelvic floor disorders. The function handles missing data, performs reverse scoring on appropriate items, and validates inputs according to scoring guidelines.

Usage

calculate_pisq12(
  questionnaire_data,
  id_column = NULL,
  item_prefix = "pisq_",
  reverse_items = c(1, 2, 3, 4),
  max_missing = 2,
  scale_to_100 = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

questionnaire_data

A data frame containing PISQ-12 item responses. Column names should follow the pattern specified by the item_prefix parameter followed by the item number (e.g., "pisq_1", "pisq_2", etc.).

id_column

Character string specifying the column name containing patient identifiers. If NULL (default), no ID column is used.

item_prefix

A character string specifying the prefix for PISQ-12 column names. Default is "pisq_".

reverse_items

A numeric vector specifying which items should be reverse-scored. Default is items 1, 2, 3, and 4, which are positively phrased items.

max_missing

The maximum number of missing items allowed before score is set to NA. Default is 2 (up to 2 missing items permitted).

scale_to_100

Logical indicating whether to scale scores to a 0-100 range. Default is FALSE (returns raw scores from 0-48).

verbose

Logical indicating whether to display detailed logging information. Default is FALSE.

Value

A data frame containing the original data plus additional columns:

  • pisq12_score: The PISQ-12 score. If scale_to_100 = TRUE, scores range from 0-100, with higher scores indicating better sexual function. Otherwise, scores range from 0-48.

  • pisq12_missing: Count of missing items for each respondent.

  • pisq12_valid: Logical indicating if the score is valid (TRUE if missing items <= max_missing).

Details

The PISQ-12 consists of 12 items measuring sexual function across three domains: behavioral/emotive (items 1-4), physical (items 5-9), and partner-related (items 10-12). Each item is scored from 0 (always) to 4 (never).

Items 1-4 ask about positive aspects of sexual function and are reverse-scored so that higher scores indicate better function. For all items, after any necessary reverse-scoring, higher scores indicate better sexual function.

Missing data is handled by:

  1. Calculating the mean of answered items

  2. Substituting this mean for missing values

  3. Multiplying by 12/(12-n), where n is the number of missing items

  4. If more than max_missing items are missing, the score is set to NA

References

Rogers RG, Coates KW, Kammerer-Doak D, Khalsa S, Qualls C (2003). A short form of the Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire (PISQ-12). International Urogynecology Journal and Pelvic Floor Dysfunction, 14(3), 164-168.

Examples

# Example 1: Basic usage with minimal data
pisq_data <- data.frame(
  patient_id = c("P001", "P002", "P003"),
  pisq_1 = c(3, 2, 1),  # Items 1-4 are positively phrased (reverse-scored)
  pisq_2 = c(4, 3, 2),
  pisq_3 = c(2, 3, 4),
  pisq_4 = c(3, 2, 1),
  pisq_5 = c(0, 1, 2),  # Items 5-12 are negatively phrased
  pisq_6 = c(1, 0, 3),
  pisq_7 = c(2, 1, 0),
  pisq_8 = c(1, 2, 1),
  pisq_9 = c(0, 1, 2),
  pisq_10 = c(1, 0, 3),
  pisq_11 = c(2, 1, 0),
  pisq_12 = c(1, 0, 1)
)

pisq12_results <- calculate_pisq12(
  questionnaire_data = pisq_data,
  id_column = "patient_id",
  scale_to_100 = FALSE,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Verbose logging enabled
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Starting PISQ-12 calculation
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Input parameters: id_column = %s, item_prefix = %s, max_missing = %d, scale_to_100 = %spatient_idpisq_2FALSE
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Validating input data
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Input validation completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Identifying PISQ-12 columns with prefix: %spisq_
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Identified %d PISQ-12 columns12
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Extracting ID column: %spatient_id
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Extracted PISQ-12 item data: %d rows, %d columns312
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Processing data types for PISQ-12 items
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Data type processing completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Applying reverse scoring to items: %s1, 2, 3, 4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d1
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d2
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d3
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Applied reverse scoring to items: %s1, 2, 3, 4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Missing value counts range from %d to %d per row00
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Calculating PISQ-12 scores
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Score calculation completed
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:45] PISQ-12 calculation completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Combining results into final output
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Final result dimensions: %d rows, %d columns34
print(pisq12_results)
#>   patient_id pisq12_score pisq12_missing pisq12_valid
#> 1       P001           12              0         TRUE
#> 2       P002           12              0         TRUE
#> 3       P003           20              0         TRUE

# Example 2: With data containing missing values
pisq_data_missing <- data.frame(
  patient_id = c("P001", "P002", "P003"),
  pisq_1 = c(3, 2, NA),
  pisq_2 = c(4, 3, 2),
  pisq_3 = c(2, NA, 4),
  pisq_4 = c(3, 2, 1),
  pisq_5 = c(0, 1, 2),
  pisq_6 = c(1, 0, 3),
  pisq_7 = c(2, 1, NA),
  pisq_8 = c(1, 2, 1),
  pisq_9 = c(0, 1, 2),
  pisq_10 = c(1, NA, 3),
  pisq_11 = c(2, 1, 0),
  pisq_12 = c(1, 0, 1)
)

pisq12_results_missing <- calculate_pisq12(
  questionnaire_data = pisq_data_missing,
  id_column = "patient_id",
  max_missing = 2,
  scale_to_100 = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Verbose logging enabled
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Starting PISQ-12 calculation
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Input parameters: id_column = %s, item_prefix = %s, max_missing = %d, scale_to_100 = %spatient_idpisq_2TRUE
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Validating input data
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Input validation completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Identifying PISQ-12 columns with prefix: %spisq_
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Identified %d PISQ-12 columns12
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Extracting ID column: %spatient_id
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Extracted PISQ-12 item data: %d rows, %d columns312
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Processing data types for PISQ-12 items
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Data type processing completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Applying reverse scoring to items: %s1, 2, 3, 4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d1
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d2
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d3
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Applied reverse scoring to items: %s1, 2, 3, 4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Missing value counts range from %d to %d per row02
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Calculating PISQ-12 scores
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Imputing %d missing values for row %d with mean %.2f221.1
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Imputing %d missing values for row %d with mean %.2f231.7
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Scaling scores to 0-100 range
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Score calculation completed
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:45] PISQ-12 calculation completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Combining results into final output
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Final result dimensions: %d rows, %d columns34
print(pisq12_results_missing)
#>   patient_id pisq12_score pisq12_missing pisq12_valid
#> 1       P001           25              0         TRUE
#> 2       P002           33              2         TRUE
#> 3       P003           51              2         TRUE

# Example 3: With alternative column naming convention
alt_pisq_data <- data.frame(
  record_id = c("R1", "R2", "R3"),
  pisq_item_1 = c(3, 2, 1),
  pisq_item_2 = c(4, 3, 2),
  pisq_item_3 = c(2, 3, 4),
  pisq_item_4 = c(3, 2, 1),
  pisq_item_5 = c(0, 1, 2),
  pisq_item_6 = c(1, 0, 3),
  pisq_item_7 = c(2, 1, 0),
  pisq_item_8 = c(1, 2, 1),
  pisq_item_9 = c(0, 1, 2),
  pisq_item_10 = c(1, 0, 3),
  pisq_item_11 = c(2, 1, 0),
  pisq_item_12 = c(1, 0, 1)
)

pisq12_results_alt <- calculate_pisq12(
  questionnaire_data = alt_pisq_data,
  id_column = "record_id",
  item_prefix = "pisq_item_",
  scale_to_100 = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Verbose logging enabled
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Starting PISQ-12 calculation
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Input parameters: id_column = %s, item_prefix = %s, max_missing = %d, scale_to_100 = %srecord_idpisq_item_2TRUE
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Validating input data
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Input validation completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Identifying PISQ-12 columns with prefix: %spisq_item_
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Identified %d PISQ-12 columns12
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Extracting ID column: %srecord_id
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Extracted PISQ-12 item data: %d rows, %d columns312
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Processing data types for PISQ-12 items
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Data type processing completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Applying reverse scoring to items: %s1, 2, 3, 4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d1
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d2
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d3
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Reverse scoring item %d4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Applied reverse scoring to items: %s1, 2, 3, 4
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Missing value counts range from %d to %d per row00
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Calculating PISQ-12 scores
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Scaling scores to 0-100 range
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Score calculation completed
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:45] PISQ-12 calculation completed
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Combining results into final output
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:45] Final result dimensions: %d rows, %d columns34
print(pisq12_results_alt)
#>   record_id pisq12_score pisq12_missing pisq12_valid
#> 1        R1     25.00000              0         TRUE
#> 2        R2     25.00000              0         TRUE
#> 3        R3     41.66667              0         TRUE
